subject: Increase test coverage for token APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 21:23:34.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/core.py'], 'message': "Increase test coverage for token APIs

The token API tests were not calling our rather exhaustive
jsonschema-based validators to ensure that the API responses were
correctly structured. Instead, they were simply ensuring that things
like validate token didn't blow up. This makes all those tests much
stronger.

Relatedly, it also introduces a regex pattern for the two timestamp
fields in tokens (expires_at and created_at).

Change-Id: Idd5de04ef333c0b03a31f445ddd1f52e3a7b9b03
Related-Bug: 1597077
"}]
commit_message:
Increase test coverage for token APIs

The token API tests were not calling our rather exhaustive
jsonschema-based validators to ensure that the API responses were
correctly structured. Instead, they were simply ensuring that things
like validate token didn't blow up. This makes all those tests much
stronger.

Relatedly, it also introduces a regex pattern for the two timestamp
fields in tokens (expires_at and created_at).

Change-Id: Idd5de04ef333c0b03a31f445ddd1f52e3a7b9b03
Related-Bug: 1597077

commit_message:
Move request validation inline

This commit moves all the decorated call to validate request inline with the
method. This is one way we can lazily validate requests - which allows us to
pick validation configuration options specifed in config.

Change-Id: Iee71fb3c34d296427cd485180dacb6bf02581845

commit_message:
Add description of server options (all, main, rest) for swift-init help

Running swift-init with -h, --help, or no arguments
displays help for the command. The help does not
document the 'main', 'all', and 'rest' options.
These are documented in the man page.

This patch adds all these server options in the
help of swift-init.

Change-Id: I8e27589912ae72ace14c955e66b86942bc23d9f7
Closes-Bug: #1580722

commit_message:
allow to specify notifications transport url

new feature was introduced in oslo.messaging (in Mitaka)
which allows to specify transport url for notifications
purpose. so, now setup of transports will be following:
we will try to setup transport for notifications
using this new feature, and if such setup is failed,
we will fallback to old scheme with re-using
service transport for notifications (for
backward compatibility).

Change-Id: I251d465863c33f60bb3b3850e987238bd326c461
Closes-bug: 1579945

commit_message:
Add Allocation and AllocationList objects

An Allocation represents a use of some class of resource from a
particular resource provider, by a consumer. They can be created
and destroyed.

It is also possible get a list of all allocations associated with a
particular resource provider.

This also includes: a small correction to functional tests of Inventory
so that its structure (where resource_class is defined) is aligned
with the Allocation tests.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint resource-providers-allocations
Change-Id: Iaec8a8e318adfd8feae6496ad962bc02d13adebd

subject: Fix fernet token validate for disabled domains/trusts
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-07 19:45:28.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': 'Fix fernet token validate for disabled domains/trusts

This commit adds a check when rebuilding the authorization context of a
trust-scoped token to make sure that both the trustor and the trustee are in
enabled domains. With this patch the uuid token provider and the fernet token
provider give the same response when caching is disabled. If caching is
enabled, the fernet provider will still consider a trust-scoped token valid
even though the trustor/trustee is in a disabled domain. A subsequent patch
will fix the revocation event to make sure the token is removed from the cache
when a domain is disabled.

Change-Id: If3e941018d5c2c9bd22397e69f83b7bf92643340
Partial-Bug: 1532280
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fernet token validate for disabled domains/trusts

This commit adds a check when rebuilding the authorization context of a
trust-scoped token to make sure that both the trustor and the trustee are in
enabled domains. With this patch the uuid token provider and the fernet token
provider give the same response when caching is disabled. If caching is
enabled, the fernet provider will still consider a trust-scoped token valid
even though the trustor/trustee is in a disabled domain. A subsequent patch
will fix the revocation event to make sure the token is removed from the cache
when a domain is disabled.

Change-Id: If3e941018d5c2c9bd22397e69f83b7bf92643340
Partial-Bug: 1532280

commit_message:
Implement ResourceProvider.destroy()

Destroying a resource provider first checks to see if there are
existing allocations associated with the provider. If there are
a ResourceProviderInUse exception is raised. If there are not,
the resource provider and associated inventories are deleted
from the database.

Change-Id: Icf0874e00bbee23aa805349e08273be09160c0de
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-dispersion-report', 'bin/swift-orphans', 'bin/swift-get-nodes', 'bin/swift-config', 'bin/swift-drive-audit', 'bin/swift-temp-url', 'bin/swift-init', 'bin/swift-recon-cron', 'tox.ini', 'bin/swift-account-audit'], 'message': 'Turn on H233 and start using print function

As much as anything, I'm just tired of seeing a bunch or piecemeal
fixes.

Note that we *need* to include

   from __future__ import print_function

in order to support things like

   print()  # Would print "()" (the repr of an empty tuple) otherwise
   print(foo, end='')  # Would SyntaxError
   print(bar, file=sys.stderr)  # Would SyntaxError

Change-Id: I8fdf0740e292eb1ee785512d02e8c552781dcae1
'}]
commit_message:
Turn on H233 and start using print function

As much as anything, I'm just tired of seeing a bunch or piecemeal
fixes.

Note that we *need* to include

   from __future__ import print_function

in order to support things like

   print()  # Would print "()" (the repr of an empty tuple) otherwise
   print(foo, end='')  # Would SyntaxError
   print(bar, file=sys.stderr)  # Would SyntaxError

Change-Id: I8fdf0740e292eb1ee785512d02e8c552781dcae1

commit_message:
Handle openstack.request_id in from_environ

The oslo.middleware request_id middleware that is used by most services
sets the request_id into the environment at 'openstack.request_id'. Pick
this value up into the context object if it is present in the
environment.

Change-Id: Iae3799f4c5ad799961a4a6b01d2b77fd97e72be3

subject: Correct reraising of exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 09:29:58.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/api/controllers/v1/port.py', 'ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ironic/api/controllers/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I98c11a0dd394c122cc3f3ade0ba651f99aec1530
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised.

Change-Id: I98c11a0dd394c122cc3f3ade0ba651f99aec1530

Add region in swift-ring-builder add

In the swift deployment guide, region is missing from the syntax of
adding a new device to the swift-ring-builder.

This patch adds region in the syntax.

Closes-Bug: #1584127

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-05-10 15:52:41.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/reconfigurable-oslo-logging.rst'], 'message': 'log: Mutable logging

There is a strong desire from operators to be able to reconfigure
logging without a service restart. For example, to selectively enable
DEBUG logging in response to observed issues. Mutable config patches
have enabled options to be mutated at runtime, now we need to do the
same for logging config. The change to allow this is simple but
unmasks a locking issue.

Change-Id: Ifee9aa74fd1c540b199ad7c0af761c8b1df8be14
'}]
commit_message:
log: Mutable logging

There is a strong desire from operators to be able to reconfigure
logging without a service restart. For example, to selectively enable
DEBUG logging in response to observed issues. Mutable config patches
have enabled options to be mutated at runtime, now we need to do the
same for logging config. The change to allow this is simple but
unmasks a locking issue.

Change-Id: Ifee9aa74fd1c540b199ad7c0af761c8b1df8be14

commit_message:
Switch to keystoneauth

keystoneclient.auth was deprecated in favour of keystoneauth1, this
patch updates Cueclient accordingly. requirements.txt was also updated
to reflect this change.

ps: oslo.seralization was added to test-requirements.txt because unit
tests were failing with its absence.

Change-Id: I7e9ce5f46f5ea53fbd8333452ab5d77e42f5b417

commit_message:
Split Sahara pacemaker roles into separate services

In order for each service to operate independently when used with Pacemaker,
the roles needed to be separated.

This also drops all pacemaker constraints, as they do not make much sense
in the composable realm.

Change-Id: Id61eb15b1e2366f5b73c6e7d47941651e40651b1
Partial-Bug: #1592284

commit_message:
Snapshot object has no attribute about size

Snapshot object has no attribute about size,but some unit tests
still use snapshot['size'].We should use snapshot['volume_size']
to modify it correctly.This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: Ibe237334482fc2decdd23181d1843cd19df95bfa
Closes-Bug: #1599522

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-08 13:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/external-auth.rst'], 'message': 'Doc update on enabled external auth and federation

By default the external auth is enabled and can cause user_id conflict
when REMOTE_USER is set due to the fact that federation uses
REMOTE_USER as well. Therefore, the docs were updated to advise users
against using both external auth and federation on the same sequence.

Closes-Bug: #1563454

Change-Id: I193f78ae0ad0232471b725d5700870c349703310
'}]
commit_message:
Doc update on enabled external auth and federation

By default the external auth is enabled and can cause user_id conflict
when REMOTE_USER is set due to the fact that federation uses
REMOTE_USER as well. Therefore, the docs were updated to advise users
against using both external auth and federation on the same sequence.

Closes-Bug: #1563454

Change-Id: I193f78ae0ad0232471b725d5700870c349703310

commit_message:
Remove invalid test methods for config option port_range

Config option port_range with parameter regex="\d+:\d+",
which means if the port_range's value doesn't match this,
a ValueError will be raised when get port_rang's value.
So simply the code and remove invalid test cases.

Change-Id: I904f81de822dbfa9d3b8c1332a81738f650216f9
Related-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
Invalidate token cache on domain disablement

This will invalidate the token cache when a domain is disabled. As a result,
trust-scoped tokens that have a trustor or a trustee in a disabled domain will
have to rebuild the authorization context instead of just retrieving it from
the cache.

Change-Id: I3f6b528c64a07980422d82c8ab5b5d4f9b01485c
Closes-Bug: 1532280

commit_message:
Isolate token caching into its own region

This will make it so that when we have to invalidate the entire token cache we
don't have to invalidate *everything* in the default region.

Change-Id: I4ee419c01cad610f14460752a13ade83234b1b42

subject: Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 17:34:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6
(cherry picked from commit db817fd5434fb87afe1f8e8e05b282d68ff9dc31)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6
(cherry picked from commit db817fd5434fb87afe1f8e8e05b282d68ff9dc31)

subject: py3: Fix using filter() for python2,3 compatibility
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-01 08:51:44.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/manager.py', 'trove/extensions/mgmt/instances/models.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_operating_system.py'], 'message': 'py3: Fix using filter() for python2,3 compatibility

On python3 filter() do not return a list.
Input:
def f1(x):
    return True if x > 20 else False
print(filter(f1, [1, 3, 42, 67]))
print(list(filter(f1, [1, 3, 42, 67])))
Output:
<filter object at 0x0224FCB0>
[42, 67]

Partially-implements blueprint py3-compatibility

Change-Id: I33943ed9b7b4e8500a69bba6fae6ef475d7ea28c
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Fix using filter() for python2,3 compatibility

On python3 filter() do not return a list.
Input:
def f1(x):
    return True if x > 20 else False
print(filter(f1, [1, 3, 42, 67]))
print(list(filter(f1, [1, 3, 42, 67])))
Output:
<filter object at 0x0224FCB0>
[42, 67]

Partially-implements blueprint py3-compatibility

Change-Id: I33943ed9b7b4e8500a69bba6fae6ef475d7ea28c

This patch moves the credential abstract base class out of core and
into backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I4007a5fe05e61f08999a4b3f6801727c08aaaa14

commit_message:
Move the credential abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the credential abstract base class out of core and
into backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I4007a5fe05e61f08999a4b3f6801727c08aaaa14

commit_message:
Move the trust abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the trust abstract base class out of core and
into backends/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: Ibe9203635ee4ad5d1afee3ad751f04de6ef66f94

commit_message:
Use OVN address set to implement remote security groups

Add OVN address set support for implementing remote security
groups. This should significantly improve performance of port
create, update and delete operations when remote security
groups are used (see [1]).

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/526972/

Bug #1600330 has been added for the follow-on work to update
the OVN NB DB sync tool.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Theis <rtheis@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I56e9eb1ded1836b9a9f7262f22daa51103bc8518
Closes-bug: #1560817

commit_message:
Make default Planner generic

Currently we have to amend the code of the Planner
for each new added Watcher Action.
This spec propose to use the plugins-parameters blueprint
so that we can configure weights via the configuration file.

Change-Id: I796c7aff7eeb80f8c030bf4f3f2865275d0f74dd
blueprint: configurable-weights-default-planner

commit_message:
Log terminate_connection exception with traceback

The volume manager is not logging a traceback for
volume driver terminate_connection failures.

This can result in an opaque error message which
is hard to troubleshoot.

Closes-Bug: #1598214
Change-Id: Ibde64e0715cc861b73434e6a9c676c7e25a37a18

commit_message:
cinder-manage db purge has issues with foreign keys

When executing purge on a database with snapshots created from volumes
with glance metadata, it fails due to a foreign key exception.
This patch adds the table at the end of the purge and forces the use of
foreign key checks on the tests

Change-Id: I67436a8319155bb47dfa67544ccae25f337ed246
Closes-Bug: #1489523

commit_message:
Base OSC plugin support

Enable neutronclient OSC plugin support.
This patch set does the following:

 - Establishes OSC plugin structure for commands and unit tests
 - Creates the OSC plugin
 - Adds OSC to test-requirements.txt

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <motoki@da.jp.nec.com>
Change-Id: I9a20bc7a3d8aa7b631fb0fd534fc5705c23326ce
Related-Bug: #1521291

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 18:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/agent.py'], 'message': "metadata: log MessagingException triggering fallback to neutron API

When fallback occurs due to MessagingException, we silently swallow
details about it and report a generic warning log message, then fall
back to using neutronclient to fetch port details. When troubleshooting
issues with metadata agent, it's often useful to know what triggered the
original fall back to neutronclient.

Let's use LOG.exception instead of LOG.warning to log those details.

Note that we don't change translation marker to _LE here to retain any
translations the message may already have in this branch.

Related-Bug: #1586025

Change-Id: Ic2b475db81a9bae6ea63f9ee8fdc87e5313d5588
"}]
commit_message:
metadata: log MessagingException triggering fallback to neutron API

When fallback occurs due to MessagingException, we silently swallow
details about it and report a generic warning log message, then fall
back to using neutronclient to fetch port details. When troubleshooting
issues with metadata agent, it's often useful to know what triggered the
original fall back to neutronclient.

Let's use LOG.exception instead of LOG.warning to log those details.

Note that we don't change translation marker to _LE here to retain any
translations the message may already have in this branch.

Related-Bug: #1586025

Change-Id: Ic2b475db81a9bae6ea63f9ee8fdc87e5313d5588

commit_message:
Fix _populate_token_dates method signature

For some reason the _populate_token_dates() method was accepting trust as a
keyword argument, but it was never used in the method. This commit removes
trust as a keyword argument from _populate_token_dates.

Change-Id: I4e6219767b731218d4727f229772ff938a8e56f5

When a trustee has a trust established with a project in a different domain, it
is possible for trust-scoped tokens to still be valid even though the trustee's
domain has been disabled. This commit adds a test to expose the behavior when
using the Fernet token provider.

Change-Id: I6e287735168ecdd52c28b7e5acf010b7a82e33c7

commit_message:
Expose bug with Fernet tokens and trusts

When a trustee has a trust established with a project in a different domain, it
is possible for trust-scoped tokens to still be valid even though the trustee's
domain has been disabled. This commit adds a test to expose the behavior when
using the Fernet token provider.

Change-Id: I6e287735168ecdd52c28b7e5acf010b7a82e33c7

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated config "quota_items"

It was deprecated at [1], and quota of resource will be registered
at initialization of APIRouter. So, no need to use the config now.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/181593

DocImpact: All references of 'quota_items' configuration option
and its description should be removed from the docs.

UpgradeImpact: Remove 'quota_items' configuration option from
neutron.conf file.

Change-Id: I0698772a49f51d7c65f1f4cf1ea7660cd07113a0
Closes-Bug: #1593772

commit_message:
Pull stadium projects from governance.o.o in utility script

For housekeeping reasons we have abandon_old_reviews.sh that is
used to purge blocked reviews from Gerrit. The project query
should be extended to all stadium projects. To avoid hard coding,
fetch the list from governance.o.o, parse it and feed it to
the rest of the script.

Change-Id: Iad40d78b7a72a4435382406373bb9f15c0ffc4a7

commit_message:
Add fip nat rules even if router disables shared snat

For legacy router, there are some iptables rules added for external gateway
port. Some of these rules are for shared snat, some are for floating ip.

When user disables shared snat of router gateway, some of the iptables rules
that floating ip needs will not be added to router. This will cause the
reported bug, ping floating ip but reply with fixed ip.

The fix will add the iptables rules that floating ip needs, no matter if
router enables shared snat. A functional test is also added for the issue.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py

Change-Id: I3cf4dff90f47a720a2e6a92c9ede2bc067ebd6e7
Closes-Bug: #1551530
(cherry picked from commit cea149212e6387932eaac8448c951d2ceb7ae23d)

commit_message:
sriov: Fix macvtap vf interface regex pattern

The check if macvtap is assigend we parse
the output of ip link show and check if
macvtap[0-9]+@<vf interface>.

This patch update the <vf_interface> regex to include
underscore as interfce can contain underscore
e.g. p2p1_0.

Closes-Bug: #1597208
(cherry picked from commit b8cadc762376361657e7106b47af2bb3889f21a0)
Change-Id: I2d41972bb8a92bcaad9cd2250be1a7cb30326180

commit_message:
Copy/remove the strongswan.d config as root

The strongswan.d config dir (usually /etc/strongswan.d) is usually owned
by root but the neutron-vpn-agent may run as non-root so the files need
to be copied as root to not get a "permission denied" error.

Change-Id: I40785f8c89b304efdf0f95469ec5a2d57b0cad60
Closes-Bug: #1586986
(cherry picked from commit beff6e945ce4cf31f4a6ae977df72410dc80b717)

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9845, 'name': 'Arista CI', 'email': 'arista-openstack-test@aristanetworks.com', 'username': 'arista-test', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14605, 'name': 'vikram.choudhary', 'email': 'vikschw@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikram.choudhary'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-22 18:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/neutron_common_flow_classifier_specification.rst'], 'message': ' A common flow classifier that can be used by Neutron features

 This patch documents the two approaches that can be
 considered to support the common flow classifier functionality.
 Multiple Neutron Stadium features need flow classifier functionality.
 Instead of each feature creating its own FC API, we should have one
 common FC API that can be used by all the features. Currently
 the features that need FC are: Tap as a service, SFC, QoS, FW, BGP/VPN.
 Common FC APIs should be a superset of FC rules used by existing features.
 The goal is to come up with one consistent way of defining the API and
 classification rules. Through this common FC API, each Neutron feature
 can define its own FC and then associate the FC instance with the feature itself.

 An approach will be chosen based on design comprehensiveness, usage simplicity,
 future extensions, implementation, upgrade, and performance complexities.

 More patches may follow up on design internals for the adopted implementation
 approach.

 Co-Authored-By: Henry Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Igor Duarte Cardoso <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: I005086178796ddd75d93ee0934a4d9acc7e09633
'}]
commit_message:
A common flow classifier that can be used by Neutron features

 This patch documents the two approaches that can be
 considered to support the common flow classifier functionality.
 Multiple Neutron Stadium features need flow classifier functionality.
 Instead of each feature creating its own FC API, we should have one
 common FC API that can be used by all the features. Currently
 the features that need FC are: Tap as a service, SFC, QoS, FW, BGP/VPN.
 Common FC APIs should be a superset of FC rules used by existing features.
 The goal is to come up with one consistent way of defining the API and
 classification rules. Through this common FC API, each Neutron feature
 can define its own FC and then associate the FC instance with the feature itself.

 An approach will be chosen based on design comprehensiveness, usage simplicity,
 future extensions, implementation, upgrade, and performance complexities.

 More patches may follow up on design internals for the adopted implementation
 approach.

 Co-Authored-By: Henry Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
 Co-Authored-By: Igor Duarte Cardoso <igor.duarte.cardoso@intel.com>

Change-Id: I005086178796ddd75d93ee0934a4d9acc7e09633

Add image signature verification metadefs

Add the properties for signature verification to Glance's
Metadata Definitions Catalog.

These are defined as part of the merged spec at:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/mitaka/approved/image-signing-and-verification-support.html

This patch moves the auth plugins abstract base class out of core and
into plugins/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core

commit_message:
Move the auth plugins abstract base class out of core

This patch moves the auth plugins abstract base class out of core and
into plugins/base.py

This removes dependencies where backend code references code in the
core. The reasoning being that the core should know about the backend
interface, but the backends should not know anything about the core
(separation of concerns). And part of the risk here is a potential for
circular dependencies.

Partial-Bug: #1563101

Change-Id: I4413ef01523d02c30af97e306069229252cb4971

commit_message:
Ensure status code is always passed as int

There is some inconsistency in calls to the wsgi render_response
function. Sometimes the status tuple uses an int for the http
status code and other times a string. The Python 3.5 gate job
discovered the problem.

This patch normalizes all calls to use an int.

Change-Id: I136b01f755ff99dfba244e79068fdaae614b2091
Closes-Bug: #1599983

commit_message:
Add ringbuilder tests for --yes option

Also added a Timeout class to test.unit to wrap possible long-running
functions. For example, if there is some regression and the "--yes"
argument is no longer evaluated correctly and the test excepts some
keyboard input, it will be terminated after a few seconds to ensure
there is no long-running blocker on the gate.

Change-Id: I07b17d21d5af7fcc594ce5319ae2b6f7f58df4bb

subject: Refactored service_definition.py into service_resources.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 23:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/service_definition.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/common/pathfinder.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/service.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/tests/common/test_utils.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/common/utils.py', 'kolla_kubernetes/service_resources.py', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml'], 'message': "Refactored service_definition.py into service_resources.yaml

- Refactor only, not a blue-print nor bug-fix.
- Refactored service_definition.py which was a python code file acting
  as a configuration file, into server_resources.yaml.  This allows us
  to modify configuration, instead of code.  It also allows to add
  configuration properties at any level... service, pod, or container if
  necessary in the future.
- Added caching to Pathfinder._find_dir so that we hit disk a lot less.

- Added objects for Service, Pod, and Container to service_resources.py.
  This paves the way in the future to add actions on each of these.  For
  example, we today have a functional _bootstrap_service('mariadb').  In
  the future, we can do 's = Service('mariadb'); s.bootstrap();
  s.verify(); s.kill()'.  We can also add methods to query status
  directly from Kubernetes API.  This code reorg allows us to structure
  this nicely for future additions.

Change-Id: I7e80cb71ddc7cac7e6b424f2c4755054e7b16c65
"}]
commit_message:
Refactored service_definition.py into service_resources.yaml

- Refactor only, not a blue-print nor bug-fix.
- Refactored service_definition.py which was a python code file acting
  as a configuration file, into server_resources.yaml.  This allows us
  to modify configuration, instead of code.  It also allows to add
  configuration properties at any level... service, pod, or container if
  necessary in the future.
- Added caching to Pathfinder._find_dir so that we hit disk a lot less.

- Added objects for Service, Pod, and Container to service_resources.py.
  This paves the way in the future to add actions on each of these.  For
  example, we today have a functional _bootstrap_service('mariadb').  In
  the future, we can do 's = Service('mariadb'); s.bootstrap();
  s.verify(); s.kill()'.  We can also add methods to query status
  directly from Kubernetes API.  This code reorg allows us to structure
  this nicely for future additions.

Change-Id: I7e80cb71ddc7cac7e6b424f2c4755054e7b16c65

commit_message:
Remove dependency of metadata service

`make-cert.sh` scripts uses metadata service to get node public/private
addresses. But it's better to remove dependency of metadata service
if it is possible.
This patch make `make-cert.sh` use KUBE_NODE_IP/KUBE_NODE_PUBLIC_IP
for setting SANs.

Change-Id: Idb30971e205e8fd94a478ef7d0bc6a30f5cab534
Closes-Bug: #1599680

subject: Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5948, 'name': 'Oleg Bondarev', 'email': 'obondarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'obondarev'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-05 17:33:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_tunnel.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6
(cherry picked from commit db817fd5434fb87afe1f8e8e05b282d68ff9dc31)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofport in vlan restore

get_vif_ports returns ports with INVALID and UNASSIGNED
ofports and get_vif_port_set does not. The main scan_ports
loop uses the latter so any INVALID ofports (i.e. ofport == -1)
will be treated as removed and have their local VLANs reclaimed.
So an INVALID ofport could have the same local VLAN as a new
port that was added after it had been reclaimed.

This was causing an error in the _restore_local_vlan_map function
since it was using get_vif_ports which would cause it to process
INVALID ports as well so it could get two network UUIDs using the
same VLAN.

This fixes it by skipping INVALID and UNASSIGNED ofports in the
vlan restoration so it matches the behavior of scan_ports
(which is responsible for deciding which ports are added/removed
for VLAN allocation).

Closes-Bug: #1526974
Change-Id: I9d722fa4fabd467ded44d9cd291a3fa4d1af90f6
(cherry picked from commit db817fd5434fb87afe1f8e8e05b282d68ff9dc31)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-04 06:09:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/ec2/__init__.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/server_tags.py', 'nova/cmd/idmapshift.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'nova/compute/monitors/__init__.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/331_add_tag_to_vifs_and_bdm.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_server_migrations.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_instance_usage_audit_log.py', 'nova/objects/aggregate.py'], 'message': 'Fix invalid import order

Made corrections in import order as per OpenStack import standards [1].

commit_message:
Update specs use RBAC instead of ACL in rbac-qos-policies.rst

In the spec document of 'rbac-qos-policies' of Mitaka release,
should be used RBAC instead of ACL, and add 'object_type' 
in the 'QosPolicyRBAC Table structure'.

Closes-Bug: #1596445

commit_message:
Simplify and DRY out LoggerFileObject recursion guard

It's not really a negative diff because the meat of the functions get
de-dented back to where they started, but it does makes it easier to
read and reason about the what these methods are acctually doing
seperately from the behavior of decorator to prevent recursion.

Change-Id: Ib40aa5805525deaf1b3881004c81062d4acc989e

commit_message:
Add create_plugin to loader

Add a create_plugin function to loaders. This can be used to create a
plugin based on options with more control than simply specifying a
plugin_class as a property.

The plugin_class property is no longer an abstractproperty however an
implementer must still provide either the plugin_class property or
implement the create_plugin function to succeed.

Change-Id: Iea2ff93cfc3c814c78f6d9cd7e0069bab7e0180b
Closes-Bug: #1595400

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-07-08 14:25:32.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/coreos/pin_latest_coreos.sh', 'imagebuild/coreos/Makefile', 'imagebuild/coreos/version.txt', 'imagebuild/coreos/coreos-oem-inject.py'], 'message': 'Bump CoreOS to 1010.6.0 (last current stable)

This approach was used instead of fetching the latest version number at
build time because that meant a CoreOS update could break our gates at
any given time.

A new CoreOS make target, 'pin_latest', was made available. This target
bumps the "pinned" version to the latest. An eventual proposal bot will
call this target to ensure we stay up to date. This also offers the
possibility for downstream operators that want to build the latest
version to call this target before building. This leads to the same
result as fetching directly in the python build script, but with more
flexibility.

This is a second attempt to merge this change, as before it caused
frequent CI failures/timeouts. The expectation is that with CoreOS only
gating on IPA, this would be lower impact and easier to mitigate.

Change-Id: I78cb2efff2293b1591b30b7e39df9fc2af98d0b2
Closes-bug: 1581673
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <sagarun@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump CoreOS to 1010.6.0 (last current stable)

This approach was used instead of fetching the latest version number at
build time because that meant a CoreOS update could break our gates at
any given time.

A new CoreOS make target, 'pin_latest', was made available. This target
bumps the "pinned" version to the latest. An eventual proposal bot will
call this target to ensure we stay up to date. This also offers the
possibility for downstream operators that want to build the latest
version to call this target before building. This leads to the same
result as fetching directly in the python build script, but with more
flexibility.

This is a second attempt to merge this change, as before it caused
frequent CI failures/timeouts. The expectation is that with CoreOS only
gating on IPA, this would be lower impact and easier to mitigate.

Change-Id: I78cb2efff2293b1591b30b7e39df9fc2af98d0b2
Closes-bug: 1581673
Co-Authored-By: Arun S A G <sagarun@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>

subject: Replace deprecated function inspect.getargspec()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 21:37:59.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/validation/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Replace deprecated function inspect.getargspec()

The inspect module has deprecated (in Python 3.4) and removed
(in Python 3.5) the getargspec() function. This patch conditionally
uses the newer getfullargspec() function for Python 3.x.

Change-Id: Id99933a42ceee9c513556a6faff8b273259ef614
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated function inspect.getargspec()

The inspect module has deprecated (in Python 3.4) and removed
(in Python 3.5) the getargspec() function. This patch conditionally
uses the newer getfullargspec() function for Python 3.x.

Change-Id: Id99933a42ceee9c513556a6faff8b273259ef614

commit_message:
Make gate-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full non-voting while we debug

The pg job's failure rate has spiked to ~75% since 7/7:

http://tinyurl.com/j4tj76v

As we near the weekend and don't have any clear regressions
to dig on we need to make the job non-voting as it's blowing
up the integrated gate.

Change-Id: Ifc9054fb084c0f69ec5fed18a025be7e6d62cfc7
Related-Bug: #1600005

commit_message:
Replace the ps options when collecting logs

This patch is replacing the "-ax" options of the ps command when
collecting the logs to "au". The "-x" option is not supported by the
BusyBox in the TinyIPA ramdisk.

Closes-Bug: #1599839
Change-Id: Id0c86db6aa16c63550890e1cd488994025f5dd68

subject: Only install to virtual environment
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 20:16:53.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/os_rally-install-venv-71cbd1f6ce4fd983.yaml', 'tasks/install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of rally inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: I815dff623fce1440a5d60f64bf69f4f563371998
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs
'}]
commit_message:
Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of rally inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: I815dff623fce1440a5d60f64bf69f4f563371998
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs

of gnocchi inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs

Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs

commit_message:
Only install to virtual environment

Remove all tasks and variables related to toggling between installation
of gnocchi inside or outside of a Python virtual environment.
Installing within a venv is now the only supported deployment.

Additionally, a few changes have been made to make the creation of the
venv more resistant to interruptions during a run of the role.
* unarchiving a pre-built venv will now also occur when the venv
  directory is created, not only after being downloaded
* virtualenv-tools is run against both pre-built and non pre-built venvs
  to account for interruptions during or prior to unarchiving

Change-Id: I7a75e87d4451d62ee4587654cf5dbfb3789991c8
Implements: blueprint only-install-venvs

commit_message:
Place cleaning function of request headers in handler

This patch migrates _clean_storlet_stuff_from_request, which is a
function specific to swift, from storlet_middleware to
storlet_handler.

It also renames the function because we only changes request headers
in the function.

Change-Id: I0b1a430dcf2428c273cd6952d2c819c8b46a7960

commit_message:
Turn on bashate and ansible-lint testing in gate

This patch makes style checking using bashate and ansbile-lint
executed with the command 'tox -e pep8', to execute them in
gate testing.

Note:
If you want to execute pep8 only, run 'tox -e pep8python'.

Change-Id: Ia481ae6dc2a0bfd0c1b755fb16c71010c7938220

commit_message:
Remove invalid test for config option scheduler_host_manager

Config option scheduler_host_manager only accepts two values
"host_manager" and "ironic_host_manager", other value will lead
ValueError, so don't test invalid value in Nova.

Change-Id: I76c2112f9a93252604582621feb755bd13d5107d
Related-Bug: #1517839

subject: Update tox configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:05:20.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into

commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I44d9a6f75c582924c509c24acc070bbbb817aaaa
(cherry picked from commit 8e48a2ebf0eb27d47de3eef876f8082375768c2c)

subject: Reduce number of API calls on nova boot
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4428, 'name': 'Liyingjun', 'email': 'yinjalee@163.com', 'username': 'liyingjun'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 10063, 'name': 'Steve McLellan', 'email': 'steven.j.mclellan@gmail.com', 'username': 'sjmc7'}, {'_account_id': 14680, 'name': 'Rick Aulino', 'email': 'rick.aulino@hpe.com', 'username': 'ricka'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-06-27 17:01:40.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/notification_handler.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-reduce-nova-api-calls-64eef45bd19fa89c.yaml', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_nova_server_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py', 'doc/source/plugins/nova.rst', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/helper.py'], 'message': "Reduce number of API calls on nova boot

Replaces some of the nova API calls with updates. The code looks really
complicated (because it is) and the reason is that the notification
processing isn't sequential; unlike the unit test, the vast likelihood
in reality is that many of the notifications for an instance will be
received almost simultaneously. As such the partial updates request the
document from the index, and then check the existing state fields. The
update is submitted with the existing version as a kind of transaction
check. This seems to work ok, and most importantly the create.end event
should always add the actual current state.

Patch also adds support for pause, shutdown and suspend (and their
counterparts) such that there'll be a state change update followed by a
full API update on the .end event.

Unit tests include some examples of boot, delete and power change
events.

Change-Id: Ie2b089a2a2d0cd6bb45d0f11ab2a8c77ff1a8fb1
Implements: blueprint nova-optionally-disable-some-events
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce number of API calls on nova boot

Replaces some of the nova API calls with updates. The code looks really
complicated (because it is) and the reason is that the notification
processing isn't sequential; unlike the unit test, the vast likelihood
in reality is that many of the notifications for an instance will be
received almost simultaneously. As such the partial updates request the
document from the index, and then check the existing state fields. The
update is submitted with the existing version as a kind of transaction
check. This seems to work ok, and most importantly the create.end event
should always add the actual current state.

Patch also adds support for pause, shutdown and suspend (and their
counterparts) such that there'll be a state change update followed by a
full API update on the .end event.

Unit tests include some examples of boot, delete and power change
events.

Change-Id: Ie2b089a2a2d0cd6bb45d0f11ab2a8c77ff1a8fb1
Implements: blueprint nova-optionally-disable-some-events

subject: Make tests less dependent on transient state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 17:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/worker_based/test_worker.py'], 'message': 'Make tests less dependent on transient state

Having to update the endpoint count every time  you add a test
class is really obnoxious and leads to a ton of pointless rebasing.
Now we just check that it finds at least the task it knows about
and call that good.

Change-Id: I96b8c6cd6cbc1fdc58dee4b18cab5699e3daa844
'}]
commit_message:
Make tests less dependent on transient state

Having to update the endpoint count every time  you add a test
class is really obnoxious and leads to a ton of pointless rebasing.
Now we just check that it finds at least the task it knows about
and call that good.

Change-Id: I96b8c6cd6cbc1fdc58dee4b18cab5699e3daa844

commit_message:
Fix monascaclient in tempest for updates

Monasca client in tempest for alarm-definition-update was wrong. All
the arguments for update alarm definition should be required. Same
for notification-update. Negative tempest tests are added for these
two conditions.

Change-Id: I4c38150c2130715f200ec044d24210bfb589d1f4

commit_message:
Fix Ceilometer profiles

* Configure ceilometer to default mongodb backend.
* remove useless sync_db parameter in pacemaker class.
* Remove duplicated resource for ceilometer central agent service with
  pcmk.
* Remove pacemaker delay resource dependency, the resource does not
  exist anymore.

Change-Id: Ie337bfe770c5b22158dc307eb36e39c2b93b95a9

commit_message:
Use include for base neutron profile

Simplify the base neutron profile so that we always include
the neutron and neutron::config classes at step 3. In doing so
we can now simplify the pacemaker version to use a simple include
which will avoid duplicate class errors.

Change-Id: I95b9188607ab6c599ad4cde6faa1deb081618f3e

subject: Fix property safety on magic search controller
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 9576, 'name': 'Thai Tran', 'email': 'tqtran@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tqtran'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 12071, 'name': 'Richard Jones', 'email': 'r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com', 'username': 'richard'}, {'_account_id': 12826, 'name': 'Rob Cresswell', 'display_name': 'robcresswell', 'email': 'robert.cresswell@outlook.com', 'username': 'rob-cresswell'}, {'_account_id': 14124, 'name': 'Matt Borland', 'email': 'matt.borland@hpe.com', 'username': 'mborland'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-24 16:31:37.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/magic-search.controller.spec.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/magic-search/magic-search.controller.js'], 'message': 'Fix property safety on magic search controller

It seems there are a few cases where properties are assumed to be on
the scope which are not present; particularly $scope.strings.  This
may be causing trouble with some of the features depending on how
they are initialized.

There may be other ways to fix the problem, but this JS should be
made safe regardless.

Change-Id: Icac2e032026d2e14939e9385f90bc34c18920fe1
Closes-Bug: 1552895
'}]
commit_message:
Fix property safety on magic search controller

It seems there are a few cases where properties are assumed to be on
the scope which are not present; particularly $scope.strings.  This
may be causing trouble with some of the features depending on how
they are initialized.

There may be other ways to fix the problem, but this JS should be
made safe regardless.

Change-Id: Icac2e032026d2e14939e9385f90bc34c18920fe1
Closes-Bug: 1552895

Config option preallocate_images only accept two values 'none' and
'space', other value will lead a ValueError. So don't test invalid

Related-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
test: remove invalid test method in libvirt/test_imagebackend

Config option preallocate_images only accept two values 'none' and
'space', other value will lead a ValueError. So don't test invalid
values.

Change-Id: I1e215438850dbe0c98ecebfde0cbe03b17ad3d3a
Related-Bug: #1517839

subject: Update tox configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I93f75e43c38d0c304bb4741cbf477fc61dd5776b
(cherry picked from commit efd296065cee7e54152cae04352324361c62533f)
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I93f75e43c38d0c304bb4741cbf477fc61dd5776b
(cherry picked from commit efd296065cee7e54152cae04352324361c62533f)

subject: Python 3: fix urllib import
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 9576, 'name': 'Thai Tran', 'email': 'tqtran@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tqtran'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 11224, 'name': 'Swami Reddy', 'email': 'swamireddy@gmail.com', 'username': 'swamireddy'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-08 07:01:27.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/copy.py'], 'message': 'Python 3: fix urllib import

Replace urllib.quote import with six.moves.urllib.parse.quote, so the
code works on Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I17e9cd9668661b6a67f33db83e0cbfc8ea6e3ca6
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3: fix urllib import

Replace urllib.quote import with six.moves.urllib.parse.quote, so the
code works on Python 2 and Python 3.

Change-Id: I17e9cd9668661b6a67f33db83e0cbfc8ea6e3ca6

commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I51af7598075995efc3d755a57daf0f82f972a4a4
(cherry picked from commit 2201cf871f0ba86f81d05a06d5265e2dcc5d4fb0)

commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:

commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: Ie08d1c8c82220e496bfa6d8b6743b5b3318c72ed
(cherry picked from commit eb495e4d80343fe9a2dca337d6ea8f8013d5f396)

commit_message:
Add internal_info field to ports and portgroups

In case of ports, it is also added to the API, as a readonly field.
It will be used for any port-specific internal information ironic
needs to store inside the port object. In this change we start using
it to store UUIDs of the cleaning ports that ironic creates, instead
of fiddling with port.extra['vif_port_id'], as extra is intended for
operator use only.

Partial-bug: #1526403

Change-Id: Ib62c3e32305619d0c55f8ec7e45b067f0f0b32d4

subject: Opt in test instance apt repo mirror configs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:09:15.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'message': 'Opt in test instance apt repo mirror configs

Rather than enabling ceph and cloud archive repos by default when when
configuring test instances to use our apt repo mirrors write out
configures for them in another directory which can be optionally
enabled.

This prevents growing dependencies on these repositories except for
where explicitly desired.

To use a mirror either symlink to the sources.list.available.d/ files or
copy them into sources.list.d/ and rerun apt-get update.

Change-Id: I410f45064080e1bb93684899028e9af34bd555a1
'}]
commit_message:
Opt in test instance apt repo mirror configs

Rather than enabling ceph and cloud archive repos by default when when
configuring test instances to use our apt repo mirrors write out
configures for them in another directory which can be optionally
enabled.

This prevents growing dependencies on these repositories except for
where explicitly desired.

To use a mirror either symlink to the sources.list.available.d/ files or
copy them into sources.list.d/ and rerun apt-get update.

Change-Id: I410f45064080e1bb93684899028e9af34bd555a1

subject: Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 15:43:54.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp

As zuul uses Ansible the ~/.ansible directory is populated with
artifacts which zuul uses to facilitate the job execution.

This patch ensures that the execution of tests does not remove
the whole ~/.ansible directory, but instead only removes the
parts which we populate.

Change-Id: I299f19cd999869dd3f41d24fbdad044816998866
(cherry picked from commit 2858aa0656cf47e27c62738472568702adb77ebe)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that gate test does not remove ~/.ansible/tmp

As zuul uses Ansible the ~/.ansible directory is populated with
artifacts which zuul uses to facilitate the job execution.

This patch ensures that the execution of tests does not remove
the whole ~/.ansible directory, but instead only removes the
parts which we populate.

Change-Id: I299f19cd999869dd3f41d24fbdad044816998866
(cherry picked from commit 2858aa0656cf47e27c62738472568702adb77ebe)

commit_message:
Remove IP availability range recalculation logic

This patch removes unreachable code that rebuilds IP address
availability data and persists in the database. This is
ultimately derived data that is now computed in memory and never
persisted. The code being removed is dead code and does not
include the contract migration for removal of the
IPAvailabilityRange models.

Change-Id: I96cb67396b8e0ebbe7f98353fad1607405944e44
Partial-Bug: #1543094

commit_message:
[PoC] Add Ansible v1.9.x compatibility

As we've hit a performance bug with Ansible 2.x [0], adding v1.9.x
compatibility seems benefitial.

- modify `ansible-playbook` invocation options to be v1.9.x compatible
- add top-level action playbooks for Ansible v1
  - set driver_info/<action>_playbook=<action>-v1.yaml to use Ansible v1
- todo: add v1 logging callback

[0] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/14219

Change-Id: I38e095bb3f4292219f984228d52953574d748fff
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
[PoC] Add callback for logging into Ironic log

With default config placement and actual logging into file/syslog will
interleave Ansible events into Ironic Conductor log, using the same
logging options as provided in ironic.conf.

For other cases (like DevStack, which by default logs simply to stderr)
path to ironic.conf and a file to log into can be set in provided ini
file for the Ansible callback

Change-Id: I2acde183004d76bd0a2d4653c11cd7de4d6cc69b
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
[WIP] [POC] Ansible deploy driver alt impl

This is an alternative implementation for Ansible deploy driver
proof of concept.

Each action is described by single playbook with roles, which is run whole.
Control of deployment types and cleaning steps is through tags and
auxiliary steps file for cleaning.
The playbooks for actions can be set per-node, as is cleaning steps
file.

Supports whole images and partition images with local boot:
- compressed images are downloaded to RAM and converted to disk device;
- raw images are streamed to disk directly from HTTP;
- config drive partition is currently supported for partition images only.

Cleaning is supported, only one clean step for disks shredding in PoC.

Requires Ansible >= 2.0.1
Neutron is mandatory.

Deploy ramdisk requirements: Python, sshd and used utilities.

Experimental DIB element:
https://github.com/pshchelo/stackdev/tree/master/dib_elements/ironic-ansible

Experimental TinyCore-based ramdisk
https://github.com/pshchelo/irsible

Tested on DevStack with VM.
128 MB RAM is found enough for a VM to deploy a standard qcow2 Cirros image
(download to RAM + convert to disk device) when using TinyCore-based
deploy ramdisk.

TODO:
- make scripts in "files" folders proper Ansible modules
- add callback hoooks for better logging during long single playbook run
- document variables available to playbooks

Change-Id: I841e83b897c8e17fda0efcd1615c08a4aa296a65
Related-Bug: #1526308

commit_message:
Warn on legacy auth options on conductor start

Pre-load config during conductor start and assert that at least 'auth_type'
option in relevant services config sections is provided.
Log a warning if it is missing as this certainly indicates that
deprecated way of loading service user credentials from
[keystone_authtoken] section is going to be performed.

Change-Id: I3156537c296d870c1a4737ea35b71835945f5fa5
Related-Bug: #1422632

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-07 22:34:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/drivers/haproxy/templates/haproxy_proxies.j2'], 'message': 'Modify template to write variable in seconds.

All documentation points that this variable is stored in
the database in seconds, while HA proxy expects this value
to be in milliseconds. This leads to a disparity in
expectations. Better solution would be to modify the docs
to tell people to use milliseconds.

Change-Id: Id8224e28826de6a9da2c378d97ad68779df2a99c
'}]
commit_message:
Modify template to write variable in seconds.

All documentation points that this variable is stored in
the database in seconds, while HA proxy expects this value
to be in milliseconds. This leads to a disparity in
expectations. Better solution would be to modify the docs
to tell people to use milliseconds.

Change-Id: Id8224e28826de6a9da2c378d97ad68779df2a99c

commit_message:
Add subresources support for PECAN

Implements adding a subresource (of extensions) to its parents
A resource and a subresource has a parent-child relationship, for example:
A qos resource has a subresource of bandwith_limit_rules. This patch will
allow urls like : /qos/policies/{policy_id}/bandwidth_limit_rules to work.

Change-Id: I43ce22ff0ab2ddcb2a1cc8965f423761f41d08c9

commit_message:
add node_deployment_info table

Size of deployment_info field in tasks table grows as n**2
(depending on number of nodes). If we have 200 nodes, the
size of the structure is about 20Mb. In case of 600 nodes it
would be theoretically about 720Mb, in practice it doesn't fit
into 1Gb.

Good solution is to put common part to separate place. But it's
not so fast. Also it will not help if all nodes will be going to
be deployed with customized deployment info.

Change-Id: Id3154ab423b0863d9cc4952335293bf5fc30df38
Partial-Bug: #1596987

subject: Update tox configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-08 16:05:31.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I5b5bf304746010a518f9743661079ce061335eb4
(cherry picked from commit 5be9099016b16b5ccd9db1dfb65893b17d71ea26)
"}]
commit_message:
Update tox configuration

In order to prepare for implementing requirements management by the
OpenStack requirements management process, and to improve the
reliability and effectiveness of test execution, this patch implements
some changes to the tox configuration:

- The minimum tox version is increased in order to be able to use
  constraints for the python packages.
- The OpenStack upper-constraints are used when preparing the test
  venv for the linters checks.
- Any proxy environment variables set on the test host are passed
  into the venv to enable testing from behind a proxy.
- The environment variables used by Ansible tests are moved into
  a new venv called 'ansible' and this environment is inherited
  by all Ansible-related tests.
- The docs test will clean-up an existing build directory before
  executing the docs build.
- The releasenotes build cannot use upper-constraints at this point,
  so it doesn't.
- The Ansible role download will no longer ignore errors so that any
  problems discovered will result in a failed test.
- The human readable logging callback plugin is implemented for
  functional testing.
- The ansible test requirements are moved into tox.ini to ensure
  compliance for requirements.txt/test-requirements.txt for the
  global-requirements management contract.
- The ~/.ansible directory as a whole is not deleted. Instead only
  the plugins and roles folders are deleted to ensure that zuul's
  Ansible artifacts are left in-place.
- The ansible-lint version is updated to support execution against a
  folder, and the test now executes against the entire role to ensure
  that it captures all applicable files for lint testing.

This is a combined port of the following:
- https://review.openstack.org/323507
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/332443
- https://review.openstack.org/338193
- https://review.openstack.org/339493

Change-Id: I5b5bf304746010a518f9743661079ce061335eb4
(cherry picked from commit 5be9099016b16b5ccd9db1dfb65893b17d71ea26)
